intro: Hydrophyllum virginicum var. pacificum, commonly known as Pacific bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are finely divided and often covered in a soft, fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
